title: Virtual Conversation: Faheem Majeed and Kathleen Ash-Milby on Joseph Yoakum
hero_caption: Joseph E. Yoakum. American Zeppolin Flight from New York City to Paris France in Year 1939, 1969. Bequest of Whitney Halstead.
short_description: Join Faheem Majeed and Kathleen Ash-Milby for a conversation around the opening of the exhibition Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw.
list_description: Join Faheem Majeed and Kathleen Ash-Milby for a conversation around the opening of the exhibition Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw.
description:
Join Faheem Majeed and Kathleen Ash-Milby for a conversation around the opening of the exhibition Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw. Majeed and Ash-Milby, both contributing writers to the exhibition catalogue, will explore Yoakum's artwork and legacy through his complicated relationship to African American and Native American identities. The conversation is led by Sam Ramos, associate director of Innovation and Creativity.

ABOUT THE SPEAKERS

This virtual event will be hosted on Zoom. Find Zoom tutorials and resources here. If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu. 

Support for this program is provided by the Allan McNab Endowed Fund
